revised_title: Frictional Behavior of Porous Metal Impregnated with P.T.F.E.
tldr: The authors conducted experiments on the frictional behavior of porous metal impregnated with P.T.F.E. (Polytetrafluoroethylene) and compared it with conventional oil-impregnated bearings. They found that the P.T.F.E.-impregnated bearings provided better performance in terms of endurance and load-bearing capacity, making it a superior material for bearing applications.
scientific_discipline: Engineering and Technology > Mechanical Engineering > Tribology
